rule: Only items that are compound words can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have their vowels in alphabetical order can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are homophones of another English word can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are anagrams of a plant or animal species can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are palindromes can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are named after a person or place can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are associated with a famous event in history can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that can be typed using only the top row of a QWERTY keyboard can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are synonyms of a word in a Beatles song title can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that can be represented in emoji form can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are a direct translation of a word from a language where English is not the official language can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have been featured in a Nobel Prize-winning author's literature can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have a prime number of letters in their names can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that can be spelled without repeating a letter can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that were mentioned in the script of the original Star Trek series can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have a scientific name in Latin can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have been referenced in a Shakespearean play can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have been depicted in a painting housed in the Louvre can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are onomatopoeic can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have appeared in the title of a New York Times Best Seller within the last decade can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that can be visually expressed as a mathematical equation can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are the title of a song by a Grammy Award-winning artist can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are mentioned in the lyrics of a Disney movie song can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have been portrayed in an Academy Award-winning film can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that can be broken down into two English words, without rearranging the letters, can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are associated with a mythical creature or folklore can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are made up of words from the titles of Agatha Christie's mystery novels can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that contain the same number of consonants and vowels in their names can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that can be formed by the chemical symbols from the Periodic Table of Elements can be brought to the picnic.

Only items that are spelled with letters that, when converted to their corresponding numbers in the alphabet (A=1, B=2... Z=26), the sum of these numbers is a Fibonacci number can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that share a common characteristic or ingredient with a dish mentioned in an episode of the "Great British Bake Off" can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are named in a Beatles song, but not in the song title, can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have been depicted on a national postage stamp can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have been mentioned in a Nobel Peace Prize laureate's acceptance speech can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have been given as a reward in a fairy tale can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have appeared in a Nobel Prize-winning physicist's published research can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are associated with a constellation or celestial body can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have their name included in a UNESCO World Heritage Site can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are formed by combining the first letters of the planets in our solar system can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that, when their letters are arranged in alphabetical order, can still form a valid English word can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have been featured in a riddle from folklore or literature can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have an odd number of syllables can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are commonly associated with a famous painting and its symbolism can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are associated with a well-known idiom or proverb can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that, when translated into Morse Code, contain an equal number of dots and dashes can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that can be spelled using the names of U.S. states, without any letter repetition, can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have been used as a currency or form of trade in a historical civilization can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have been mentioned in a universally recognized nursery rhyme can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that can be categorized as a natural phenomenon or event (e.g., eclipse, avalanche) can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are a common slang or colloquial term in at least two different English-speaking countries can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are typically found in a school classroom can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have a color in their name can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are also the name of a major city in the world can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are typically found in a children's storybook can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are typically used in a birthday celebration can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are typically associated with a traditional Christmas celebration can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that have a double letter in their names can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are typically found in a doctor's office can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are typically found in a kitchen can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are typically found in a grocery store can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are made entirely of recyclable materials can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are typically found in a park can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are typically found in a garden can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that start with the letter 'F' can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are typically associated with a beach vacation can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are typically associated with a wedding can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are typically used for camping can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are typically found in a bakery can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are typically found in a zoo can be brought to the picnic.
Only items that are typically found in a library can be brought to the picnic.
